column1: Wilcome "Jolly" Cotton was a Hobbits of Bywater.

column2: named after his uncle Wilcome Cotton I. Jolly and his brother helped their father fend off Sarumans ruffians
column3: and actively participated in the revolt and Battle of Bywater.

column1: From Old English willa "pleasure" + cuma "guest"; Wilcuma is a welcome guest. Jolly comes from Old French jolif "merry
column3: which is cognate to the word yule.Jim Allan (ed.)
